com.paypal.merchant.sdk
Enum CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents>
      com.paypal.merchant.sdk.CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents>
Enclosing interface:
CardReaderListener
public static enum CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents
extends java.lang.Enum<CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents>

These are the events you might be sent. Some are swiper specific and others are applicable to ChipAndPin events.

Enum Constant Summary
BadSwipe
          When the card reader/SDK could not read the swiped or the inserted card.
CardBlocked
          When the card used by the user has been blocked.
CardChipBroken
          When a card inserted into the EMV device has a broken chip.
CardInserted
          When a card is inserted within the EMV device.
CardInvalid
          When an invalid card is inserted within the EMV device.
CardRemoved
          When the card is removed from the EMV device.
ChargedBattery
          Indicates the EMV device is charged completely.
ChargingBattery
          Indicates the EMV device is connected to the charger.
DecisionRequired
          When a user is prompted to select an application on the inserted card with which they would like to proceed with the transaction.
LowBattery
          Indicates the EMV device is running low on battery.
NeedPin
          When the user is prompted to enter the pin on the EMV device.
NeedPinLastAttempt
          When the user is prompted one last attempt to enter the pin on the EMV device.
OnBattery
          Indicates the EMV device is currently running on battery.
PinBlocked
          When the pin entered is blocked.
PinEntered
          When the user has entered the pin on the EMV device.
PinEnteredLastChance
          When the user has one last chance to enter the correct pin on the EMV device.
PinIncorrect
          When a user has entered an incorrect pin on the EMV device.
PinVerified
          When the pin entered by the user has been verified.
RequestToApprove
          When the transaction is approved by the EMV device.
RequestToCancel
          When the transaction is cancelled by the user on the terminal.
RequestToDecline
          When the transaction is declined by the EMV device.
RequestToFail
          When the transaction has failed.
RequestToTerminate
          When the transaction has been terminated.
SoftwareVersionNotSupported
          Cannot proceed further until the terminal is updated.
SwipeNotAllowed
          Indicates that the EMV device is not accepting card swipes yet.

Enum Constant Detail

SoftwareVersionNotSupported

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents SoftwareVersionNotSupported
Cannot proceed further until the terminal is updated.

BadSwipe

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents BadSwipe
When the card reader/SDK could not read the swiped or the inserted card.

CardInserted

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents CardInserted
When a card is inserted within the EMV device.

CardInvalid

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents CardInvalid
When an invalid card is inserted within the EMV device.

CardRemoved

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents CardRemoved
When the card is removed from the EMV device.

NeedPin

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents NeedPin
When the user is prompted to enter the pin on the EMV device.

NeedPinLastAttempt

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents NeedPinLastAttempt
When the user is prompted one last attempt to enter the pin on the EMV device.

PinEntered

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents PinEntered
When the user has entered the pin on the EMV device.

PinIncorrect

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents PinIncorrect
When a user has entered an incorrect pin on the EMV device.

PinEnteredLastChance

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents PinEnteredLastChance
When the user has one last chance to enter the correct pin on the EMV device. Else, the transaction could be declined or cancelled.

PinBlocked

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents PinBlocked
When the pin entered is blocked.

PinVerified

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents PinVerified
When the pin entered by the user has been verified.

CardBlocked

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents CardBlocked
When the card used by the user has been blocked.

CardChipBroken

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents CardChipBroken
When a card inserted into the EMV device has a broken chip. In this case, the user maybe requested to use the swipe feature on the EMV device to proceed with the transaction. NOTE: Along with this event, a string based boolean value is sent within the PPError.getDetailMessage() that allows the app to check whether the merchant can ask the user for a fallback swipe or not.

SwipeNotAllowed

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents SwipeNotAllowed
Indicates that the EMV device is not accepting card swipes yet.

RequestToApprove

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents RequestToApprove
When the transaction is approved by the EMV device. Once the app receives this event, it can either take the user to the signature screen (in case of a signature type card) or directly to the receipt screen.

RequestToCancel

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents RequestToCancel
When the transaction is cancelled by the user on the terminal. Once the app receives this event it would need to wait for the TransactionManager to emit the "TransactionCancel" PPError object via the response handler prior to taking the user to the next screen.

RequestToDecline

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents RequestToDecline
When the transaction is declined by the EMV device. Once the app receives this event it would need to wait for the TransactionManager to emit the "TransactionDeclined" PPError object via the response handler prior to taking the user to the next screen.

RequestToFail

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents RequestToFail
When the transaction has failed.

RequestToTerminate

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents RequestToTerminate
When the transaction has been terminated.

DecisionRequired

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents DecisionRequired
When a user is prompted to select an application on the inserted card with which they would like to proceed with the transaction.

OnBattery

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents OnBattery
Indicates the EMV device is currently running on battery.

ChargingBattery

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents ChargingBattery
Indicates the EMV device is connected to the charger.

ChargedBattery

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents ChargedBattery
Indicates the EMV device is charged completely.

LowBattery

public static final CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents LowBattery
Indicates the EMV device is running low on battery. Please connect to a charger.
